identificationModule.briefTitle: Systematic Evaluation of Patients Treated With Stroke Devices for Acute Ischemic Stroke (STRATIS) Registry
identificationModule.officialTitle: Systematic Evaluation of Patients Treated With Stroke Devices for Acute Ischemic Stroke (STRATIS) Registry

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this registry is to assess clinical outcomes, and different factors that may affect these clinical outcomes such as systems of care, associated with the use of Covidien market-released neurothrombectomy devices intended to restore blood flow in patients experiencing acute ischemic stroke due to large intracranial vessel occlusion.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This is a prospective, multi-center, non-randomized, observational registry of acute ischemic stroke patients that have or will undergo treatment with the use of a Covidien market-released neurothrombectomy device (as the initial device used to remove the thrombus) within 8 hours of stroke symptom onset, at the discretion of the investigator and independent of participation in this registry. This registry may enroll up to 1000 patients.

armGroups.label: Medtronic NV market-released device
armGroups.description: Patients experiencing an acute ischemic stroke due to a large vessel occlusion treated with a Medtronic Neurovascular market-released neurothrombectomy device.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Assessed for Revascularization With mTICI Grades 2b-3
primaryOutcomes.description:
Assess revascularization using modified Thrombolysis in Cerebral Infarction (mTICI) score at the end of the procedure. This scale determines the response of therapy for ischemic stroke based on angiographic appearances of the treated occluded vessel and the distal branches.

Classification:

grade 0: no perfusion grade 1: antegrade reperfusion past the initial occlusion, but limited distal branch filling with little or slow distal reperfusion grade 2a: antegrade reperfusion of less than half of the occluded target artery previously ischemic territory grade 2b: antegrade reperfusion of more than half of the previously occluded target artery ischemic territory grade 3: complete antegrade reperfusion of the previously occluded target artery ischemic territory, with absence of visualized occlusion in all distal branches (higher values represent better outcomes)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 0-At the completion of the thrombectomy procedure

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of Neurological Events of Interest
secondaryOutcomes.description: Evaluate events causing neurological deterioration (defined as ≥ 4 worsening points from baseline on the NIHSS scale)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 90 days post index procedure

otherOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 90 days post index procedure

otherOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants With Good Functional Outcome (mRS 0-2)
otherOutcomes.description:
Score based on modified Rankin Scale (mRS). The modified Rankin Scale (mRS) is a scale used to measure the degree of disability or dependence in daily activities of people who has had a stroke.

Clasiffication:

0 - No symptoms.

1. - No significant disability. Able to carry out all usual activities, despite some symptoms.
2. - Slight disability. Able to look after own affairs without assistance, but unable to carry out all previous activities.
3. - Moderate disability. Requires some help, but able to walk unassisted.
4. - Moderately severe disability. Unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance, and unable to walk unassisted.
5. - Severe disability. Requires constant nursing care and attention, bedridden, incontinent.
6. - Dead. (lower values represent less disability)

otherOutcomes.measure: Incidence of Device Related Serious Adverse Events
otherOutcomes.description: Any device-related serious adverse events associated with the use of a Covidien/Medtronic market-released neurothrombectomy device during the index stroke procedure up to 90 days post index stroke procedure.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 90 days post index procedure

otherOutcomes.description: Arterial access puncture to revascularization measured in minutes. Lower values indicate shorter time to revascularization and vice versa.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 0-At the completion of the thrombectomy procedure

otherOutcomes.measure: Incidence of Procedure Related Serious Adverse Events
otherOutcomes.description: Any procedure related serious adverse events occurring upon insertion of a Covidien/Medtronic market-released neurothrombectomy device during the index stroke procedure up to 90 days post index stroke procedure.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 90 days post index procedure

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient or patient's legally authorized representative has given Informed Consent according to Good Clinical Practices (GCP) and/or IRB and/or local or institutional policies.
* Patient has experienced an acute ischemic stroke due to large intracranial vessel occlusion (with associated symptoms) and has been or will be treated with a Covidien market-released neurothrombectomy device, as the initial device used to remove the thrombus.
* Treatment within 8 hours of stroke onset.
* Pre-Stroke Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) score ≤ 1 (immediately) prior to stroke onset.
* Pre-treatment National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) ≥ 8 and ≤ 30.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Concurrent participation in a multicenter randomized study.

locations.facility: Mercy San Juan Medical Center/ Mercy General
University of Massachusetts Memorial Medical Center
St. Luke's Hospital of Kansas City
Oregon Health and Science University Hospital

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Only multi center data will be available

measures.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measures.populationDescription: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Assessed for Revascularization With mTICI Grades 2b-3
outcomeMeasures.description:
Assess revascularization using modified Thrombolysis in Cerebral Infarction (mTICI) score at the end of the procedure. This scale determines the response of therapy for ischemic stroke based on angiographic appearances of the treated occluded vessel and the distal branches.

Classification:

grade 0: no perfusion grade 1: antegrade reperfusion past the initial occlusion, but limited distal branch filling with little or slow distal reperfusion grade 2a: antegrade reperfusion of less than half of the occluded target artery previously ischemic territory grade 2b: antegrade reperfusion of more than half of the previously occluded target artery ischemic territory grade 3: complete antegrade reperfusion of the previously occluded target artery ischemic territory, with absence of visualized occlusion in all distal branches (higher values represent better outcomes)
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Day 0-At the completion of the thrombectomy procedure

groups.title: Successful Revascularization
groups.description: Successful reperfusion (mTICI 2b-3) per imaging core lab

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Neurological Events of Interest
outcomeMeasures.description: Evaluate events causing neurological deterioration (defined as ≥ 4 worsening points from baseline on the NIHSS scale)
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: up to 90 days post index procedure

groups.title: Neurological Deterioration
groups.description: Neurological Deterioration up to 90 days (any event causing neurological deterioration; defined as ≥ 4 points worsening from baseline on the NIHSS scale).

outcomeMeasures.title: All-cause Mortality
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: up to 90 days post index procedure

groups.title: All-cause Mortality
groups.description: All cause mortality up to 90 days post index stroke procedure

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Good Functional Outcome (mRS 0-2)
outcomeMeasures.description:
Score based on modified Rankin Scale (mRS). The modified Rankin Scale (mRS) is a scale used to measure the degree of disability or dependence in daily activities of people who has had a stroke.

Clasiffication:

0 - No symptoms.

1. - No significant disability. Able to carry out all usual activities, despite some symptoms.
2. - Slight disability. Able to look after own affairs without assistance, but unable to carry out all previous activities.
3. - Moderate disability. Requires some help, but able to walk unassisted.
4. - Moderately severe disability. Unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance, and unable to walk unassisted.
5. - Severe disability. Requires constant nursing care and attention, bedridden, incontinent.

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Device Related Serious Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: Any device-related serious adverse events associated with the use of a Covidien/Medtronic market-released neurothrombectomy device during the index stroke procedure up to 90 days post index stroke procedure.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: up to 90 days post index procedure

groups.title: Study Device-related SAEs (Site Reported)
groups.description: Incidence of study device-related SAEs \<= 90 days post procedure

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Revascularization
outcomeMeasures.description: Arterial access puncture to revascularization measured in minutes. Lower values indicate shorter time to revascularization and vice versa.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Day 0-At the completion of the thrombectomy procedure

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Procedure Related Serious Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: Any procedure related serious adverse events occurring upon insertion of a Covidien/Medtronic market-released neurothrombectomy device during the index stroke procedure up to 90 days post index stroke procedure.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: up to 90 days post index procedure

groups.title: Procedure-related SAEs (Site Reported)
groups.description: Incidence of procedure-related SAEs \<= 90 days post procedure

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: Up to 90 days post index stroke procedure
adverseEventsModule.description: Per protocol SAEs were collected up to 90 days post index stroke procedure: all-cause mortality, device-related SAE associated with the use of Covidien/Medtronic market-released neurothrombectomy device during the index stroke procedure and procedure related SAE occurring upon insertion of Covidien/Medtronic market-released neurothrombectomy device during the index stroke procedure. Non-SAEs were not required to be collected per protocol.

eventGroups.title: Adverse Events
eventGroups.description: Serious adverse events reported per protocol during the study

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Researchers may Publish their individual site experience, but Sponsor reserves the exclusive right to Publish (or coordinate the Publication of) the complete accumulated results of the Registry, and to establish authorship criteria for such Publications for the Registry group based on Registry conduct and compliance, contribution to the Registry's design, management or enrollment and willingness to accept the rights and responsibilities of an author.
